1.42 A timber storage and transportation company has a large warehouse used for storing and selling timber. Due to seasonal price fluctuations of timber, the company purchases timber at the beginning of each quarter. A portion is sold during the current quarter, and another portion is stored for sale in later quarters. It is known that the company’s warehouse has a maximum timber storage capacity of 20 thousand m³, and the storage cost is (a + b u) yuan per m³, where a = 70, b = 100, and u is the storage time in quarters. The purchase prices, selling prices, and estimated maximum sales volumes per quarter are given in Table 1-18. Table 1-18
QuarterPurchase Price (thousand yuan per thousand m³)Selling Price (thousand yuan per thousand m³)Estimated Max Sales Volume (thousand m³)
Winter410425100
Spring430440140
Summer460465200
Autumn450455160
Because timber is not suitable for long-term storage, all stored timber must be sold by the end of autumn each year. Task: Formulate a linear programming model for this problem in order to maximize the company’s annual profit(in thousand yuan).
